API Reference

This page provides detailed documentation for the Metric Query Library API.

metric_query_library

metric_query_library.transformations

metric_query_library.label_ops

metric_query_library.type_defs

metric_query_library.validation

Rust API

The following functions are implemented in Rust and exposed to Python:

Note

These functions are documented here for completeness, but they are typically accessed through the Python API described above.

Core Transformations

metric_query_library._rust.moving_average(metric, window_size)

Calculate the moving average of a metric over a specified window size.

Parameters:

  • metric (dict) – The metric to transform

  • window_size (int) – The size of the moving average window

Returns:

A new metric with the moving average values

Return type:

dict

metric_query_library._rust.rate(metric)

Calculate the rate of change of a metric.

Parameters:

metric (dict) – The metric to transform

Returns:

A new metric with the rate values

Return type:

dict

metric_query_library._rust.sum(metrics)

Sum multiple metrics together.

Parameters:

metrics (list) – A list of metrics to sum

Returns:

A new metric with the summed values

Return type:

dict

Label Operations

metric_query_library._rust.filter_by_label(metrics, labels)

Filter metrics by label.

Parameters:

  • metrics (list) – A list of metrics to filter

  • labels (dict) – A dictionary of labels to filter by

Returns:

A list of metrics that match the labels

Return type:

list

metric_query_library._rust.group_by_label(metrics, label_keys)

Group metrics by label.

Parameters:

  • metrics (list) – A list of metrics to group

  • label_keys (list) – A list of label keys to group by

Returns:

A dictionary of grouped metrics

Return type:

dict
